title: three month old baby girl
story: Three-month-old baby girl killed in husky attack died from head and neck injuriesKyra Leanne King sustained head and neck injuries in a dog attack in the car park of Ostler’s Plantation, a wooded area near Woodhall Spa, Lincs, at .pm on  MarchKyra Leanne King died at Ostlers Plantation Image: James Turner Lincolnshire LiveByPaul Whitelam:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar A three-month-old baby girl reportedly killed by a aposHuskyapos died from head and neck injuries, an inquest heard this morning. Kyra Leanne King lost her le in the car park area of Ostler’s Plantation, a wooded area near Woodhall Spa, Lincs, at .pm on  March.Two people were arrested following the death, but they have been released under investigation, Lincolnshire Live reported. Assistant Coroner for Lincolnshire Paul Cooper today opened the inquest into Kyraaposs death during a short hearing at the Myle Cross Centre in Lincoln. Lincolnshire Police Detective Chief Superintendent Andy Cox previously said: “This is an exceptionally sad incident, and one that we know will impact the local community, or indeed anyone hearing about it. “There may be a temptation to speculate about what happened while people attempt to understand this tragedy, and we’d ask people to avoid doing so, particularly on social media where facts can become distorted.  We will do everything we can to establish what has happened, and we’d like to thank everyone for their support.” The inquest heard evidence from Coroneraposs Officer Jackie Foxlow who confirmed that East Midlands Ambulance Service were called to Ostleraposs Plantation. A preliminary postmortem carried out by Forensic Pathologist Dr Stuart Hamilton at Leicester Royal Infirmary recorded the provisional cause of death as head and neck injuries. The inquest opening also heard evidence from temporary Detective Inspector Cally Murray, who told the hearing it remained a live investigation and enquiries into the circumstances are continuing while two people remain under investigation. The officer said the child died after sustaining injuries from a dog attack, but added that investigators were keeping an open mind about the incident generally. Lincolnshire Police will be seeking a destruction order against the dog, which has been seized and remains in kennels, once active proceedings are completed, the inquest heard. Assistant Coroner Cooper adjourned the inquest to a date to be fixed and said it could take some months for enquiries to be completed.  Assistant Coroner Cooper said: This is a sad case. There is a grieving family out there. Any social media comments could be hurtful. The breed of dog involved in the incident, which happened in the car park area of Ostler’s Plantation, was not disclosed during the hearing, but Lincolnshire Police have previously said they believed it to be a Husky. Officers launched an investigation into the death and previously arrested a -year-old woman and a -year-old man on suspicion of being in charge of a dog which was out of control. They were later released under investigation.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Lincolnshire PoliceDangerous dogsInquests" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news tiny-sausage-dog-obsessed-carrying-"Sausage dog carries huge stick past surprised onlookersByNia DaltonSpecialist Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A tiny dog with a passion for extra large sticks is making millions of people smile.Five-year-old dachshund Bosco is obsessed with seeking out the biggest stick in the park - and insists on carrying it around in everyoneaposs way. The mischievous little pup will often obstruct walkways, but nobody ever gets annoyed with him - heaposs far too adorable for that.Bosco has a loyal following online with over . million fans on TikTok, and has even started his own dog stick trend. Owner Luccia Rodriguez, , based in London, told The Mirror : Carrying big sticks is Boscoaposs favourite thing to do. He loves making people happy and thrives off the attention.  to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories. In the video of Bosco, you can see just how popular he is with local dog walkers in the park, who all make way for his royal canine highness. He proudly walks with his ginormous stick, taking up the entire pathway and dodging peopleaposs feet. Strangers will clap for Bosco and most people get their cameras out to film, Luccia said. Elderly people seem to be such big fans. Luccia says Boscoaposs stick obsession started when he was six months old, and heaposs loved them ever since. It was soon after a storm and we were walking on a heath. He spotted big branches that had been blown over and tried to pick one up, she explained.  We thought it was cute and he loved the attention from other people in the park so started to do it more.About three years ago, Luccia began posting videos of Bosco on Instagram for family and friends to see - then one year ago created a TikTok account and it took off.His fans are most shocked by the tiny size of Bosco and the huge sticks he succeeds in carrying. He manages to find that perfect spot and will try again and again until he does. He doesnapost like the stick dragging, Luccia said.When he gets tired, heaposll drop it and carry on with the walk. As much as Bosco would love to take each and every giant stick home, Luccia just doesnapost have the space for it. Itaposs not just sticks Bosco has a habit of picking up - heaposs carried water bottles, dummies, brooms, walking canes and even scooters. Heaposs a bit like a raccoon - he loves picking up general rubbish, she said. Luccia will often replace Boscoaposs sticks with props for big holidays - on Valentineaposs Day it was an arrow, and at Christmas it was a tree. She says Bosco definitely thinks heaposs a big dog and has little man syndrome.  Though itaposs no surprise heaposs got confidence, when celebrities like Will Smith have shared their love for him online. Bosco met Ricky Gervais in the park once and barked at him, and Will Smith reposted one of his videos, Luccia said. Luccia describes Bosco as adventurous, loving and independent, and says he has a very strong personality. He puts everyone in such a good mood and it makes me happy when people are so nice, she added.Do you have a dog story to tell  Contact nia.dalton@reachplc.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON TeamDogsDogsAnimals" data-immediate"data-immediate"Calling all dog lovers!to TeamDogs for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: gay teacher sacked explaining pupils
story: Gay teacher sacked for explaining to pupils why he was wearing a pride braceletJay Bowman was sacked from his job at Huntington Local High School, in Ohio, after he told pupils why he wore a rainbow pride bracelet, violating a school policyJay Bowman, who lost his job at Huntington Local High School Image: NewsflashByKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments A gay teacher was sacked after he explained to his pupils why he was wearing his rainbow pride bracelet. Substitute teacher Jay Bowman had been asked by some pupils about the bracelet he wore and explained the importance behind it and offered them the one he had on. However, that led to his sacking from his school, Huntington Local High School, in Ross County, Ohio.His sacking led to a huge protest as hundreds of people, including parents, teachers and pupils voiced their support for him. Bowman said he was asked by some students about his ‘First Capital PRIDE’ rainbow-coloured ban, a local LGBTQ+ rights organisation. He told the Scioto Valley : When approached by students who expressed a certain point of view, I happily slid the band off my arm, offered it to the student, and explained that First Capital Pride offered support groups for teens who may be struggling, are suicidal, are ostracized, and need support.  However, he was dismissed soon after, and claimed it was because of this action as school policies prevent teachers from discussing “religious and political topics”. The school considered supporting LGBTQ+ rights amongst this and he said the school told him they had received community complaints, Mr Bowman spoke out to ABC about his sacking, he said: I know Iaposve opened a can of worms and I know Iaposve started a discussion, and I trust that the members of this community know that I did that with no ill intent.On Facebook he added that the greater lesson here isnapost about me ever being welcomed back, saying that instead it is about that student sitting alone in the classroom, feeling like they are somehow less.The now openly gay man, who has been teaching for over  years, added: If a kid has questions,a kid wants honesty, I donapost think I should be forbidden from providing that. However, the teacher’s sacking proved unpopular and he received overwhelming support from parents and students. Pupils even staged a protest outside the high school and some even reportedly wore pride bracelets in class to support of Mr Bowman.  The school board maintained that he “violated board policies by speaking to students about political and religious topics, as well as distributing bracelets”. In the past, Mr Bowman had remained “closeted” not telling anyone that he was gay to avoid the sack. He is now speaking up after his dismissal because he does not want any student to “feel less”. He said: Huntington is my home. It is where I got my first teaching job. It is everything to me. I love this community. I love this school. He said in a post dated  March: I am a good, student-first teacher. I love all Godaposs children and the kids at Huntington will always hold a place in my heart. “Huntington Schools is home to me. I lived there for more years than anywhere . I do not ever put students at risk. “I work hard at reaching out to every single student I meet. These great kids respond well to me and we have a genuine teacher student affection for one another.  He added: By the way Ohio state law still permits firing anyone just for being LGBTQIA+. Some donapost realised this fact. Then, he posted a second time three days later, adding: The purpose of my   post was not for the district to be punished in any way, shape or form but feel they should be open  honest about how lowly they regard the LGBTQIA+ and not hide behind a flimsy policy. I hold no ill will towards anyone affiliated with their decision to cancel me. He went on to say: The adminaposs reasoning for cancelling merings more than a bit hollow to me. “If the bandshad been supportive of any number of other ideas entities, I believe the outcome would have been far dferent. “Current post responses shares reveal a strong disparity between the policy used against me  the views of the broader community .Bowman also said: Remember, the greater lesson here isnapost about me ever being welcomed backor about showing hatred towards anyone. “It is about that student sitting alone in the classroom, feeling like they are somehow less. And showing them that they can change their world!!Members of the local community are planning to bring the matter up at a school board meeting scheduled for  April in a bid for them to reconsider the policies. The Scioto Valleyreports that the school is now at risk of losing its federal funding over the matter, saying: On his first day in office, President Biden issued an executive order declaring that prohibitions on discrimination on the basis of sex cover discrimination on the basis of gender identity and sexual orientation. [...] It is unknown how much of the local school districtaposs funding is federal, but it is believed millions of dollars are at risk. title: inside eerie abandoned mansion dad
story: Inside eerie abandoned mansion where dad killed son, , and buried him under porchUrban explorer David Built has captured the eerie interior of the Allan Lucy Murder House in Alabama, US, where a -year-old boy was killed by his adoptive father PhilipThe Hardie-Coleman house in Uniontown, Alabama, became known as the Allan Lucy Murder House Image: mediadrumDavidBulitByRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Mar |comments New pictures show the inside of a lavish mansion that has been left to rot following a gruesome murder that went unsolved for nearly a decade.Urban explorer David Bulit took a peep inside the property in Uniontown, Alabama, US - known as the Allan Lucy Murder House. Originally called the Hardie-Coleman house, it acquired its sinister new name after the -year-old was murdered in  and discovered buried under the grand porch. Allan lived there with his adoptive parents Philip and Margaret Lucy when he went missing and they claimed he had run away to Florida to live with his friends. It was only when the couple sold the home and the new owners began renovating it years later that the truth came out. A builder discovered the teenaposs remains wrapped in a Disney blanket in  while inspecting the foundations. The mansion, built in , was then abandoned. David, who runs Abandoned Alabama, has revisited the property to get a series of eerie pictures. He said: Ironically, Allan’s adoptive parents were arrested just a week prior to the remains being discovered on an arson charge in connection to the fire that damaged the house.Police believed they torched the house in order to claim on the , insurance policy which was purchased just a month prior. While the couple was in custody, authorities performed a thorough investigation of the property and questioned family members before charging Philip Lucy with murder. He added: Residents will never forget the events that unfolded there in .  Korean War veteran Philip was found guilty of murder in . He was then re-convicted on appeal in  and hung himself the same day in his jail cell. Margaret was implicated in Allanaposs death but was allowed to remain free to care for her other kids. She orced Philip but died of cancer in .  The coupleaposs biological son, Jason, told anyone who would listen that he had seen his father in the kitchen strike Allan in the head with his fist, knocking him to the ground. Jason claimed he was ordered to go to his room and later saw Philip walking around outside covered in dirt and holding a shovel. No one believed him for years until the truth was discovered.  One of Davidaposs snaps shows the crumbling front of the house, where the body was discovered. Another shows the living room with whitewashed patches on the yellow paint. Other photos show the extent of the overgrown greenery, and how many rooms are littered with construction supplies. The market value of the property plummeted after the murder. It is currently owned by Elmendorf Air Force Base in Alaska. title: woman 25 made partner 59
story: Woman, , made partner, , promise to get vasectomy reversal before dating himNena Zahed says getting married and having kids were two of the most important things that she wanted out of le so took steps to see how serious Jose Martinez really wasFlight attendant Nena Zahed and nephrologist Jose Martinez met at a restaurant - and an ultimatum was coming Image: mediadrumworld @thirtyfiveyeBySam Elliott-GibbsReporterAmy Walters:,  Mar |comments A woman says she made her partner who is  years older than her promise to get a vasectomy reversal before agreeing to date him.Flight attendant Nena Zahed, , met her -year-old boyfriend Jose Martinez at a restaurant in June . They quickly struck up a conversation and chatted for hours at the bar after dinner. The pair exchanged numbers and several days later they met up for their first date - but there was something on her mind. While the age gap didnapost bother either of them, Nena was concerned that nephrologist Jose had had a vasectomy and got made him agree to have it reversed so they could one day start a family.  The woman from Florida, US, said: We didnapost feel love at first sight despite really liking each other. I was intrigued to see him again, but we thought our connection would be something very casual. During one of our dates, we got to talking about our futures where Jose mentioned that he didnapost want to get married and that as he had a vasectomy, he wouldnapost be able to have kids. After that, I didnapost really see the relationship going anywhere as marriage and kids are two of the most important things to me. We continued to see each other every few months after this, but despite our attraction to one another, the age dference definitely made us both quite sceptical of the relationship going anywhere serious.After taking a trip around Florida, I could tell that Jose was falling in love with me. I think he realised that I was a lot more apprehensive, but after three months, I couldnapost hide my feelings for him any longer. After four months of dating, the duo decided to move in together once their relationship had reached new levels. Although the two have had their doubts about their relationship, they are now planning in the near future to get engaged and hope to tie the knot shortly after. If the vasectomy reversal fails for any reason, we will likely pursue IVFneeded. We want to be able to have a family together, which most people think is crazy, she went on.  People donapost understand why Jose is having a baby so late and they donapost understand why I want to have a baby with someone who is far older than me - but we feel connected like soulmates and want to experience having a family together. Thereaposs a thirty-five year age gap between us, which was a struggle for Jose to get over at first as people kept staring at us each time we were out in public. I have dated older guys before, so I wasnapost too fussed - but even thirty-five years was a bit of a push for me at the beginning. However, we get along so well - heaposs the best friend Iaposve ever had. We do most things together and Jose treats me like a princess by surprising me with romantic gts such as flowers.  I also treat Jose like the king that he is by surprising him with things like an indoor picnic which I did for our anniversary, as well as other little gts. Critics accuse her of being a aposgold diggerapos and him of being a apossick old man,apos but Nena said they are soulmates. Iaposve shown him a new way of le, which has helped him to come out of his comfort zone - which erases any doubts that we had, she said. We told Joseaposs family and friends in May  who were really supportive. Due to this, I went on to tell my family and friends. Despite my friends being happy for us, my family werenapost very accepting besides my sister - which Iaposm not too fussed about, as Iaposm not that close to my family. I moved in with Jose after around four months of being together, which has been so fun and neither one of us have ever been so excited to come home to someone in a very long time. For the future, weaposre planning on getting engaged and hopefully married soon after. Starting a family is very high up on our priority list and I thinkJose wasnapost open to getting a vasectomy reversal, we wouldnapost have made it as a couple. news us-news woman-lived-cool-streak-under-"TikToker discovers cool streak on her nail is cancerByVanessa ChalmersSamantha Mordi:,  Mar |commentsA woman who thought a streak that had been growing on her nail for years was cool was horried to be told what it really was. Maria Sylvia said she first noticed the dark brown mark ten years ago - but thought nothing of it, as she was in and out of doctors all the time due to being an athlete.The Tik Toker - who has more than , followers - shared the news online after finding out it had probably been cancerous for the last three years. Doctors tol her it was subungual melanoma, a serious form of skin cancer that takes hold in the skin under your nails She said on her page @invrfoundwaldo : No one really noticed it until one time a doctor did notice it. This was probably circa , and they were like, aposoh, thataposs oddapos. But you donapost really fit the demographics. Maria, from the US, was offered surgery in which doctors removed her nail and part of the bone. She said: “Melanoma can sit in a stage called in situ, which is kind of like stage zero, for up to  years. “So itaposs very likely that this has just been sitting for  years and itaposs been maybe cancerous for the last three, itaposs kind of hard to tell.” When she woke up she had a cast covering her entire hand and stopped her thumb from moving as it recovered.Mariaaposs thumb was given a skin graft, with doctors taking flesh from her arm. Sheaposs now waiting to see what the final result will look like. He video, which has reached  million people, has left viewers worried about their own similar streaks. Medical advice warns that you should go and see a doctoryou see a change in size, colour, or shape of the nails. If your nail separates from the nail bed, bleeds, thins or cracks or has a bruise that wonapost go away - it could be a sign something is wrong. Melanoma is the worst form of skin cancer and is usually caused by eexposure to UV rays. But caught early, it has a good survival rate with  per cent of people survivingthe cancer is detected at stage one. There are still more than , melanoma skin cancer deaths in the UK every year. title: aldi worker shares most annoying
story: Aldi worker shares most annoying things that customers say - like scan slowerA former Aldi worker has dished the dirt on the annoying questions customers would ask her in a TikTok video that she just "hates hearing" - like being told to scan slowerKelcey revealed all Image: tiktok @kelceyatkinsonxByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsEvery wondered what supermarket employees are really thinking whilst youaposre busy doing the food shop  Well hereaposs your chance to find out. Former Aldi employee Kelcey Atkinson has revealed what really makes her tick - and you might be one of the culprits.The -year-old from the UK shared a list of some of the regular questions sheaposs asked by shoppers on a daily basis on her TikTok account, @kelceyatkinsonx, and many other supermarket employees could relate.She began: Things I, an Aldi worker, hate hearing. She started off by saying that one of the things that annoy her the most is being told to scan slower - and unsurprisingly, this happens very often. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Then she says sheaposs regularly asked why the food is so cheap. Other questions she gets, included: Have you got it round the back  and can I speak to your manager  Kelcey also gets frustrated when sheaposs asked whether she gets a discount, when items will be back in stock and whether something can be put aside for a later date.Since being posted, the video has racked up more than , likes and dozens of comments from people who were keen to share their thoughts. One person said: Donapost forget aposcan you scan the bags firstapos when the bags are at the end of their shopping. Another wrote: I work in Lidl and hear the exact same things. A third commented: Mood I can confirm. Someone  put: Same omg itaposs so annoying.An Aldi shopper previously revealed four hacks she swears by to beat the speedy cashiers - and people were in hysterics at her comical techniques.Uyen shared moves you should try to keep up with the cashiers when shopping at ALDI, on TikTok where sheaposs known as @uyenthininh, and itaposs since gone viral. Take a look at them here. Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: boys handwritten note hidden church
story: Boys handwritten note hidden in church pew found after  yearsA choirboy wrote a note and hid it in a church pew back in  but it remained secret for , as it was recently discovered during a renovation fo the churchTracey Mienie in the seat where the hidden message was found Image: PAByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Mar |comments A handwritten note that was hidden in a church pew by an orphaned choirboy in  has finally been found - after  years.William Elliott was just  when he wrote the letter on the back of a choristeraposs order of service at Sunderland Parish Church and stuffed it in a crack of a pew. Work was carried out during lockdown to restore the Grade I Georgian listed building, and someone looking at the wooden benches found something they thought looked unusual. They soon realised it was paper and extremely delicate, and conservationists worked on it to remove decades of dust, grime and polish so the words could be deciphered. What do you think about the discovery  Let us know in the comments...William wrote in pencil: Dear friend, whoever finds this paper think of William Elliott who had two months and two weeks and four days on the  of August . Whoever you are that finds this paper donapost tear it up or throw it away ... keep it in remembrance of me, W Elliott ... I was the leading boy of this choir ... I love youyou love me. Research by Seventeen Nineteen volunteers, who are taking over the space, revealed Williamaposs father was chief officer Thomas Duncan Elliott who was sailing on the vessel Skyros when he was washed overboard in . Williamaposs mother Sarah Ann Elliott was left a widow with four children and, although the family had been fairly comfortable until then, by  she was working as a dressmaker to keep the family afloat. William was eligible for admittance to the orphanage after his fatheraposs death and was ultimately accepted the following year. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. He was discharged on October  , his th birthday - just weeks after he wrote his letter. He avoided going to sea, unlike many of the other boys at the orphanage, and worked for a local solicitor after leaving. After , the trail grows cold and nothing more can be found of William. But next to the framed copy of his letter, which hangs in the churchaposs Lady Chapel next to the very seat in which the boy composed it, is a wooden plaque commemorating the dead of the Great War. And, listed among the dozens of names of the parishaposs fallen men and boys, is an inidual with the same name but dferent spelling - W Elliot. His plea to be remembered has inspired Seventeen Nineteen to launch The Dear Friend project, inviting anyone who wishes to, to write a letter back to William. Centre manager Tracey Mienie said: His letter has touched us all. He was clearly very aware that his time at the orphanage, and in the choir, was ending and I think apprehension at what his future may hold comes across in his words. title: cleaning guru shared tips how
story: Cleaning guru has shared tips on how to take your house to the next levelTikTok cleaning guru Caroline has shared her top tips on how to keep your home in tip-top condition, and by following them soon youll be on top of your housework like the best of themTikTok cleaning guru Caroline has shared her top tips on keeping your home in shape Image: Getty ImagesByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Mar |comments A cleaning guru has shared her top tips for making le easier - and by following them you can take your housekeeping aposto the next levelapos.TikTok star Caroline, @neat.caroline, shared a series of tips and tricks, from how to wipe down mirrors, to getting your appliances shining like they are brand new.The advice is a real game-changer, and even though some of the points are common sense they will still make the chore of cleaning that much easier. Carolineaposs video proved popular with her followers on social media and soon she had thousands of views, alongside countless comments - although most people seemed more interested in her cat.  What do you think about Carolineaposs cleaning hacks  Let us know in the comments...In the clip, Caroline said: Here are some tips that will take your cleaning game to the next level. One - Clear up all surfaces entirely instead of just cleaning underneath everything. Two - Use the aposSapos pattern to clean surfaces. Three - Mop your way out of a room so you donapost have to clean the floors twice. Four - Pre-treat surfaces with a product, this makes wiping down surfaces a lot easier. Five - For a streak-free finish, always wipe down stainless steel surfaces with the grain. For even shinier results, use a microfibre cleaning cloth.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. Six - Always dust before you vacuum, this way you donapost need to vacuum twice. Seven - Use a rolled-up towel to protect your knees while you clean. Eight - Bring your cleaning caddy with you around the house to save time. In the comment section, Caroline shared more tips to get your house sparking. She said to clean windows, you should use a mixture of water and vinegar, and to mop the floors use warm water and a small amount of washing up liquid. title: i turned up sister laws
story: I turned up to my sister-in-laws wedding in a matching dress - it was comicalA woman took to Reddit to ask whether she was in the wrong for wearing a similar dress to the one that the bride was wearing on her big day - even though it wasnt a traditional white gownThe bride was less than impressed Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Mar |commentsA woman has been accused of trying to upstage her sister-in-law on her wedding day after she turned up wearing a similar dress.In a post on Reddit, the wedding guest explained that she and her sister-in-law have always gotten on well, but outside of family gatherings they donapost really keep in touch.Sheaposd been invited to her wedding and had bought a new almost floor- blush pink dress for the occasion. Not white with a bit of blush, but like, obviously pink, so I thought this was totally fine and not breaking any etiquette rules, she explained. It also had spaghetti straps and wasnapost too apospoofyaposyou know what I mean. So you can imagine her surprise when she sees the bride walking down the aisle in a blush wedding dress with spaghetti straps. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. She literally gives me daggers and what made the situation worse was that we both had our hair down in a similar styleand we both have the same shade of red hair. It was almost comical, she said. Since the wedding, she claims the entire family have been super cold with her, including her cousin who called her an a**hole for trying to upstage the bride and that she should have avoided blush as itaposs an obvious bridal colour. The family seem to think I did this deliberately because Iaposd been upset that I hadnapost been invited to the bridal shower or bachelorette and had been feeling a bit excluded, she said. I was upset at the time, but this was not deliberate sabotage. I honestly felt like it was just an awkward accident but nah. She concludes her post by asking whether she should have known that blush was also a no-go colour for wedding guests, and Reddit users were quick to share their thoughts.One person said: If a bride is wearing anything but white and doesn’t want to be upstaged she needs to let people know. People aren’t mind readers. Another wrote: This! I had an invitation to a wedding party which explicitly said aposThe bride will be wearing a red dress, so please donapost wear a red suit or dress. Red accents and ties are fine!apos And I was like aposCool, I wonapost wear red.apos But this is...not done nearly that well. In an update, the woman revealed where things went wrong... She said sheaposd told her husband about this post as an, aposI told you soapos that she was [not the a**hole]apos and how it was impossible for her to have known what the bride was wearing, however...Apparently heaposd been told it wasnapost white, but he didnapost tell me that as he thought it wasnapost info worth sharing. He has a habit of not passing on info that other people would expect him to, such as family members being ill, breakups etc. He told [mother-in-law] that he didnapost even remember about the dress being blush so couldnapost have told me, and they seem to think heaposs just lying to cover for me. This is all news to me becauseIaposd known I would have immediately understood why [sister-in-law] was so shocked upset. Do you think she was in the wrong or whether the bride overreacted  Let us know in the comments.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: i wanted child free wedding
story: I wanted a child-free wedding - guests still brought their kids and ruined the dayA woman has been left furious after her friends ignored the no kids rule at her wedding and let their rowdy children ruin her day - so she charged the parentsThe woman specically didnt want children at her weddingImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Mar |comments While some people might love nothing more than having young family members at their wedding, others would rather opt for a child-free event that bans anyone under a certain age from attending. And although a child-free wedding might be less than ideal for guests with kids, itaposs important to respect the wishes of the bride and groom - especiallytheyaposve also gone out of their way to provide childcare for you. But one woman on Reddit has vented her frustrations after her guests chose to completely ignore her request to keep kids away from her big day, even after she hired a total of five babysitters to help look after the little ones of any guests who couldnapost find their own childcare. The bride, from the US, also explained she doesnapost have a problem with children, but her venue charged full price for all children over the age of two, meaning an extra for every child who attended the wedding.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.In her post, she said: The kids are generally good, so the main issue was the cost. We wrote this on the website and claried it with anyone who asked. We got a lot of grief over this, so we felt a fair comprise was to:. Extend the dinner the night before to include kids, and the restaurant was very nice about having close to  kids. . Hire  babysitters for - kids on the wedding night for locals who couldnapost find a babysitter last-minute, and for guests who travelled with their kids. My in-laws offered their home less than  minutes away to host all the kids. On the day of her wedding, three couples arrived with a total of nine children between them - and when the groomsmen offered to take the kids to the babysitting location, the parents made a scene.  The children stayed at the wedding, but the event soon descended into chaos - with some kids throwing food. The bride added: When the ceremony started, one kid started wailing and another skipped down the aisle in front of me. I played it cool, and the staff was on top of it. They escorted the mum and the  kids outside. The rest of the ceremony went smoothly. During the reception, the same  kids were screaming and throwing food. Other guests and staff were trying to get them to sit. At one point, one kid went under my dress, which was so f***ing weird. I didnapost notice and almost tripped. My bridesmaids pointed out that the food they threw got on my dress and thataposs when I had enough. I gave my husband aposthe lookapos and he rounded up the kids, brought them to the parents, and asked them to leave for good. After the event, the bride and her husband decided to send a bill to the three couples who brought their children to get them to pay the extra  per head. And while two couples were immediately apologetic and paid without question, the couple with the particularly rowdy brood refused to pay up - because they were asked to leave before the cake was cut. She said: After the event, we sent a bill to the three couples with a letter saying we had a lovely time with them and reminding them that they agreed to pay for the uninvited kids. Two couples paid and were apologetic, and even said they understood why we couldnapost include the kids. Of course, the couple with the  rowdy kids refused to pay because we asked them to leave before cake ... seriously. Instead of apologising, we got a nasty call. All I said was they should be lucky I didnapost send the dry cleaning bill for the dress.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON MarriageWeddingsWedding day" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news weird-news loch-ness-monster-spotted-first-"First Nessie sighting of  caught on cameraByJohn BettAudience WriterSean MurphyTourism Writer:,  Mar |comments A Loch Ness Monster hunter has recorded the first official sighting of Nessie this year, after spotting apostwo objects moving parallel to each otherapos. Eoin OaposFaodhagain is a veteran spotter and regularly records sightings via the lochaposs webcam, but he was worried as no one had seen the monster for a while, as the Daily Record reports.He kept his eyes peeled and monitored the webcam day and night, as well as the Official Loch Ness Monster Sightings Register where no official sightings had been recorded for three months.But Eoin, who had his first sighting back in , was watching the webcam live stream last Wednesday afternoon , when he spotted something unexplained. What do you think about the Loch Ness Monster  Let us know in the comments...He explained that it appears to be two objects moving parallel to each other across the middle of the screen. The -year-old shared the video capture of the virtual sightings, which show strange dark shapes moving about on the surface of the loch. When one person commented that the clip could just be of a log or some debris, Eoin responded: The more northerly object takes a sharp turn to the left leaving an unusual wake, you would have to rule out a log or debris, and it is not consistent of a seal to react in such a manner.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. Inverness-based Register keeper Gary ­Campbell, who has recorded more than , alleged sightings of mystical Nessie over the past  years, recently stated that the start of the year and the end of winter is usually quiet time for the monster. He added that didnapost mean they havenapost had any reports in , far from it, but much like the majority of claimed sightingsthey are explainable they donapost make it into the register. It appears the latest video was deemed credible enough to be unexplainable and therefore has been added to the list. news weird-news man-brings-entire-gaming-console-"TikTok user reveals her boyfriend played video games while she was in labourByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsThe birth of a child is an exciting time for many couples - but it can also be a very long and strenuous process. One dad-to-be came up with a solution to pass the time - playing on his gaming console - and it caused quite the stir online. Preempting how long it could take for his son or daughter to arrive, the man in question decided to bring his entire gaming system to the hospital while his partner Amber was in labour for  hours.Amber shared footage of her partner with her back to her, headphones on, playing a shooting game on her TikTok @amberscxttin a video that has had . million views.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. My boyfriend brought his entire gaming system to the hospital during my -hour long induction, she wrote over the top of the video. Since being posted, the video has racked up more than , likes and , comments from viewers who were ided on whether this was acceptable. Absolutely not, said one person. Another wrote: Wow. Red flag, friend. A third commented: I love my games but I’ve never attempted to do this got better things to worry about.Someone  said: I wouldn’t mind after labour but during is a dferent story. But others were quick to defend him, as one person said: I mean what ya wanted him to do  Sit there for  hours staring at her  She was probably more entertained watching him play... I would be. And another viewer commented: I went through a long induction process as well and I definitely wouldn’t have mindedmy kidaposs father brought his game.Amber assured unhappy viewers that it was okay, as she wasnapost in any type of pain till  hours later when it was almost time to push. And for those  hours, I watched movies and browsed TikTok. How would you feelyour partner did the same  Let us know in the comments.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: my friend getting married next
story: My friend is getting married next month - but I just found her on a dating appA man has been left baffled after he stumbled across his best friend on a dating app just one month before shes due to get married - and she lied about her profileThe man isnt sure whether to tell his friends partnerImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Mar |comments In the age of online dating, having a profile on a dating app while youaposre in a relationship isnapost automatically a sign of anything malicious - especiallythe account has been unused for a while. But whatyou had an active dating profile that was in use just one month before you were due to get married  Thataposs what one man on Reddit has seemingly found after he accidentally stumbled across a Bumble profile for one of his best friends, who is set to tie the knot in May, just over one month away. In his post, the man explained he was told about the profile by another friend before going to check it out himself, and when he confronted the -year-old woman about her account, she lied to him about its origins.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. He said: A close friend of mine for years is engaged to a guy who I really like and is getting married in May. Yesterday, a friend of mine found her on Bumble and texted me screenshots. I sent them to her askingthere is something I should know, and she replied that they must be from when she was still single and that she probably forgot to turn it off. Thing is, I recognise the pictures and theyaposre recent. My girlfriend and I are even in one of them. I had spoken to her fiancé earlier that day about bachelor party plans and everything sounded like it was very much still on. The man now wondershis friend is having second thoughts about the marriage, and is unsure of whether or not to approach her fiancé with the dating app evidence. He added: Some of our friends have joked that she can do better - sheaposs really, really attractive and makes great money, while heaposs very much the blue-collar type. But he treats her like a princess, a big upgrade from the boys sheaposs dated in the past. I get the feeling sheaposs having second thoughts and looking around again. Iaposm kind of conflicted on whether or not I should bring this up, andI do, whether I should talk to her or him about it. Sheaposs a close friend andthings donapost work out, itaposs her side that Iaposll take. But Iaposve been in toxic relationships before and canapost help but think Iaposd feel very guiltyhe marries her next month without knowing sheaposs not fully invested. Commenters on the Reddit post suggested the man tell his friendaposs partner what he found, as while it might hurt the groom-to-be in the short-term, heaposll appreciate being told. One person said: I know plenty of people might say stay out of it and I understand that to some degree, but all I can think is thatI were that guy I would hope someone would tell me that information before I got married to a person like her. While another added: He deserves to be able to make an informed choice. Show him the same compassion and respect that youaposd want to be shown.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON RedditDatingCheating" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: theatre goer storms out play
story: Theatre-goer storms out of play and demands refund with ridiculous complaintA member of the audience at York Theatre Royal has complained to the establishment after paying for a ticket to Shakespeares As You Like It and becoming outraged by one defining aspect of the productionThe disgruntled punter stormed out of the play at the York Theatre Royal Image: Kennedy News Google MapsBySophie NorrisJessica TaylorReal Le Features Writer:,  Mar |commentsA mardy theatregoer has been mocked after they stormed out of a Shakespeare play and demanded a refund - because the actors had Yorkshire accents. The disgruntled customer had paid for a ticket to comedy play As You Like It at the York Theatre Royal last week, performed by the Northern Broadsides theatre company. In advertising the play, the Halax-based company tells punters it will be performed as bold, accessible and unapologetic Northern voices. Jess Rooney, who works for the company, said the complaint had made everyone chuckle because it was so outrageous. She said: Iaposm not sure who the complaint applied to specically but pretty much all of the actors have a Northern accent. They donapost hide them. Our whole selling point and what we do dferently is Shakespeare in northern voices. We were just quite bemused by it at first. Weaposve been working on ing northern voices on stage for the last  years. For more of the news you care about straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here In my time, Iaposve never seen this complaint. The play, which ran from  March to  March, is advertised as being performed by apos Northern actorsapos and has been praised by critics. But when one unhappy audience member complained about the proud Northern actors, the staff were left in stitches. Jess said: Itaposs a normal thing to hear northern voices and Yorkshire accents on stage these days. We were one of the first to do this  years ago and since then I think a lot of people have taken it on board. Itaposs more of a thing people enjoy to hear. It makes the [characters] sound like them and people can relate to it a little bit more. A lot of Shakespearian language is hard to get used to anyway soyou hear it in your own voice, it makes the experience a lot more accessible. She added the complaint had actually done the company the world of good. In a tweet, York Theatre Royal chief executive Tom Bird made it clear the disgruntled punter had no chance of getting a refund.He wrote: Weaposve got a complaint this morning @YorkTheatre from someone who left after an hour of @NBroadsides #AsYouLikeIt last week, because it had aposYorkshire accentsapos in it.Thataposs Yorkshire accents, right here in Yorkshire. They want a refund.One Twitter user replied: Surely in the top  of ridiculous complaints Another said: Yorkshire accents, in Yorkshire, from a Yorkshire-based theatre company, that was SPECIFICALLY created to showcase Yorkshire accents in all roles  Heaven forbid. Others claimed the complaint fit a narrative that northern accents are less valued because theyaposre not received pronunciation. York Theatre Royal was approached for comment. news world-news amazon-worker-claims--hour-"TikTok user shares experience of her Amazon night shtByChloe MorganSamantha Mordi:,  Mar |commentsAnAmazon employee has shared the reality of working at the worlds biggest e-commerce warehouse. With millions of orders a day, it is no surprise that its thousands of workers are often rushed off their feet.The TikToker, who goes by the name @latequileralashes on the , has shared the reality of gruelling  hour shts on the days she is at work.In a video posted on the popular social media site, she said she is dead before she even starts the day. After getting up at .pm, she brushes her teeth and puts on makeup. She arrives at pm and jokes: I always try and park away from everyone because I hate them all.In the footage, she starts work at pm and places sealed boxes into yellow slots, which she says she does until am. She adds: It’s a  to  hour sht - but I usually VTO so I always go home early. My feet always end up hurting after this. She continues: Ignore everyone  and don’t tell people your business. The woman then reveals that working at Amazon isnapost all that bad, telling future hopefuls to make one or three friends.  She added: Alsoyou’re a couple at Amazon, y’all be the reason it feels like high school. She reveals that employees wait for packages till am, before finally getting a lunch break. Social media users took to the comments section to praise her for doing the job. One user said: Girl, all this is true lol. I work at a delivery centre. Girl honestly I don’t know you but I’m proud of you! I could never work overnight I wouldn’t sleep at all during the day idk how you do it! added another. title: baby born two heads three
story: Baby born with two heads, three hands and two hearts after mum told to expect twinsDoctors say they are not planning surgery after Shaheen Khan gave birth to her child, who was born with a condition known as dicephalic parapagus - where two infants are joined by one torsoThe boys arrival stunned medics, as well as his parents Image: Rareshot News   SWNSBySam Elliott-GibbsReporterAmy Reast:,  Mar |comments A baby shocked doctors and his mum after arriving with two heads, three hands and two hearts.Shaheen Khan was told she would be having twins when she fell pregnant with her first baby in Ratlam, in the Indian state of Madhya Pradesh.The condition known as dicephalic parapagus - where two infants are joined by one torso - was undetected before the birth.It often results in a stillbirth but after surviving, doctors said on Tuesday they are not planning surgery. The miracle baby has been admitted to a hospital in the nearby city of Indore to be monitored by medics.  Mum Shaheen remains in the district hospital in Ratlam. It is unclear from reportsthe arrival is being treated as conjoined twins or one child. Local reports describe it as a baby but the condition is considered a rare form of partial twinning. One of the doctors, Dr. Lahoti, said: These kinds of cases are rare and the condition of babies remains uncertain, especially in the initial days. Due to this, we have kept them under observation. We have not planned for any surgery on the patient.  The doctors had told the parents that they have twins after conducting an ultrasound but were not aware of this condition. The third hand is towards the back between the two faces.In , a baby born with two heads has survived an operation operation to amputate the second head.Sana Hilel, from Aleppo, Syria, had her seventh child, Abdullat Shekrak, by Caesarean section after cranium bidum was detected in the womb.  Facing death, the baby was quickly transferred to Iskenderun Developmental Hospital where a brain, nerve and spinal surgery specialist removed the second head. Dr Mehmet Koparan, who performed the surgery, said a case this severe would often have been fatal. In general, encephaloceleis seen in one in , live births, he said. Grades three and four are less common, and often deadly. This case is grade three. title: enormous new star could oldest
story: Enormous new star could be oldest ever detected and explain evolution of universeThe discovery of Earendel, a star which is said to be . billion years old, has excited experts who believe it may hold important answers to the evolution of the universeThe newly-discovered star is said to be fty times bigger than the Sun Image: NASA, ESA, Brian Welch , Da SWNSByMark WaghornSam Elliott-GibbsReporter:,  Mar |comments An enormous star dating back nearly  billion years is the oldest ever to be detected, astronomers have claimed. The discovery - which has been described as an extraordinary new benchmark - could help explain the evolution of the universe, experts hope.Over fty times bigger than the Sun, the staraposs light has only just reached Earth. Co-author Dr Selma de Mink, of the Max Planck Institute for Astrophysics, Germany, said: Itaposs kind of like finding an old photograph of your great-grandparents. These stars are basically our aposstellar ancestorsapos. We are, after all, made out of the elements they once produced. Yet we have so many unanswered questions.  Named Earendel, or morning star in Old English, it beats the previous record by almost four billion years. The observations - based on data collected by Hubble - are a huge leap further back in time. Co-author Dr Guillaume Mahler, of Durham University, said: This might be the earliest star we will ever see since the Big Bang. It was so surprising. It is so much younger than the previous entry of nine billion years - at first I didnapost believe it.It is believed to be one of the most massive stars out there - millions of times brighter than our own. Even so, Earendel would be impossible to spot at such a great distance without the aid of a huge cluster of galaxies that sit in its path. They warp the fabric of space - creating a powerful natural magnying glass that distorts and greatly amplies the light from distant objects behind. Dr Mahler said: Gravitational lensing is like observing galaxies under the microscope and with technology such as the Hubble telescope, you start to see what is inside.Thanks to the rare alignment Earendel appears virtually directly on a aposrippleapos - providing maximum illumination. It pops out from the general glow of its home galaxy - its brightness magnied by a factor of thousands. The effect is similar to little waves on the surface of a swimming pool - creating patterns of light on the bottom. They act as lenses - focusing sunlight. Lead author Brian Welch, a PhD student at Johns Hopkins University in Baltimore, said:We almost didnapost believe it at first - it was so much farther than the previous most distant star. Normally at these distances, entire galaxies look like small smudges. This galaxy has been magnied and distorted by gravitational lensing into a long crescent that we named the aposSunrise Arcapos. Studying Earendel will be a window into an era of the universe that we are unfamiliar with - but that led to everything we know. Itaposs like weaposve been reading a really interesting book but we started with the second chapter - and now we will have a chance to see how it all got started. Earendel is described in Nature. It will remain highly magnied for years to come as its infrared light is stretched by the universeaposs expansion. NASAaposs recently launched James Webb Space Telescopeis highly sensitive to these longer waves. Co-author Dr Dan Coe, of the Space Telescope Science Institute in Baltimore, said: With Webb we expect to confirm Earendel is indeed a star - as well as measure its brightness and temperature. We also expect to find the Sunrise Arc is lacking in heavy elements that form in subsequent generations of stars. This would suggest Earendel is a rare massive metal-poor star. Precise details of the star remain uncertain - something the authors say JWST will determine in the future. Dr de Mink added: Most exciting for me is some of the black holes recently detected by gravitational waves are remnants of stars that lived back then. I hope Earendel and future similar discoveries will help us understand a little more about the origin of these black holes. title: influencer worst night life after
story: Influencer has worst night of her le after stabbing herself in eye with fake nailJessica Cardoso was getting ready for a night out with friend Camila Pudim when she was forced to go to hospital after accidentally piercing her cornea with her fake nailThe Brazilian had to ensure a hospital dash after the fake nail faux pas Image: NewsflashByLee BullenSam Elliott-GibbsReporter:,  Mar |comments A Brazilian beauty influencer says she felt like someone had just stuck a kne into her eye after scratching off a chunk of her cornea with a fake nail.Jessica Cardoso says suffered the worst night of her le when her evening out was ruined thanks to the painful accident when she was getting ready.The brunette has shared images of her bandaged eye on Instagram for her . million followers on Tuesday.Revealing the injury was caused by her tapered nails, she received plenty of sympathy after the hospital dash. Cardoso, , said she scratched her eye with her talon-like extension while she was with her friend and fellow influencer Camila Pudim.She explained: I did my nails, which were tapered. I, not being very clever, went to scratch my eye and as I moved, my fingernail ripped out a bit of my cornea. Thataposs what the doctor said. The Brazilian beauty added: I did not see anything on my nail so I thought I just scratched my eye. But according to the doctor, a piece really came off.She was unable to open both her eyes for a while. Cardoso told her Instagram followers: It was the worst night of my le. When I tried to open one eye, the other eyelid started to strain. It felt like there was a kne hurting my eye. She said she is following the doctoraposs recommendations and is currently taking eye drops and painkillers, adding that she should be able to see normally again after her treatment. It comes as an influencer who was injured in a horror jet ski accident on her birthday has woken after being in a coma.Polina Strelets, from Saint Petersburg, Russia, has regained consciousness after nearly a month following a crash with another jet ski rider while on holiday in Bali.The -year-old was rushed to hospital after suffering a double leg fracture, injuries to the base of her spine and brain swelling. title: mum who spent 12000 having
story: Mum who spent £, having % of body tattooed told shes going straight to hellTattoo artist and mum-of-one Raven Moreira, , from Goi nia Goi s, Brazil said the £, she spent on getting % of her body tattooed has helped to improve her confidence and self-esteemRaven Moreira, , from Brazil, says she has stopped counting how many tattoos she has as they are all becoming one Image: mediadrumworld @raven_ByChloe ShakesbyRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments This mum says some strangers tell her sheaposs going straight to hell while others want to marry her because of her £K body modications. Tattoo artist and mother -of-one Raven Moreira, , from Goi nia Goi s, Brazil said that until getting her first tattoo at age , she lacked confidence - but that things have changed since then.Raven estimates that up to % of her body is now tattooed, along with extreme modications such as eye colouring. And although Raven loves her look - which she has spent around ,BRon - she says that not everyone is so keen. Peopleaposs reactions to me y a lot, said Raven. Although there are many people who abhor my look, most praise me and are inspired by who I am today.Iaposve heard all kinds of comments possible, even people saying aposyouaposre going straight to hell for being like thisapos or apositaposs ruining your beautyapos. However, others say aposyou are my inspiration, as a mother, as a personapos, call me aposa goddessapos or say aposI wish I had your strength.apos Raven, who has a five-year old daughter Mikaelly and co-parents with her ex-partner, didnapost always see herself as strong, and before her body modications lacked confidence. Raven said: Before the changes I was a shy person. I was afraid to speak, I didnapost know how to express myself, I didnapost feel enough.  I got my first tattoo when I was eighteen, but the modications and extreme tattoos I started doing two years ago. Today I believe that I have  to % of my body tattooed. I had the eyeball colouring done one year ago and the burcationof the tongue seven months ago. I had dental implants placed two years ago - it was my first signicant modication. I think Iaposve spent an average of , to ,or more with all the modications including the tattoos, I stopped counting a while ago. Ravenaposs unique looks also attract plenty of attention, and she receives both marriage proposals and offers of sex regularly. My look attracts a lot of admirers of all sexes, she said.  I get proposals - both marriage and sexual - all the time. Even though they feel desire for someone they barely know, I really like to feel wanted - but I always make it clear that I am not a sexual object. I believe people have a certain fetish for something they canapost understand, and a lot of curiosity too. My look affects my romantic relationships a lot, I think because Iaposm still discovering myself. I am not a woman of many loves, and I have a strong personality, it gets in the way of my romances a lot. Even with all the changes Iaposve had, Iaposm still a girl who dreams of a happy family, a reciprocal love, someone who accepts me as I am, and doesnapost try to change or mould me. Ravenaposs family and friends are also supportive of how she looks - although some call her crazy.Although my family donapost understand my choices very well, they accept me as I am, and are proud of my achievements as a person. Of my friends, some say itaposs crazy, others use me as a reference of aposstrength and personalityapos and admire me for always fighting for what I want. And while she appreciates the support, the main person that Raven is looking for approval from is herself. Today I am a more centred person, my high esteem has improved %, she said. Iaposm not afraid to be me. I am not the same person I was three years ago and I believe that in a year I will be very dferent from what I am today. My goal is to evolve as a person and change myself much more until I feel totally good about myself. title: rich slave owners 20m sorry
story: Rich slave-owners got £m but were still waiting for apology and racism to endThe Royal tour of the Caribbean was a disaster, says Eva Simpson, but at least it has got us talking about slavery and highlighting a very unsavoury history lesson on compensationProtesters gather outside an office of the British government to demand that the United Kingdom pay reparations for centuries of slavery Image: REUTERSopinionByEva Simpson:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Prince William’s trip to the Caribbean may not have been the triumph he and his team hoped it would be. But the one good thing to come out of it is reigniting the ­conversation around the payment of reparations.When slavery was abolished in , Britain paid £million, equal to % of its annual income, in ­compensation.However, the money, worth about £billion today, didn’t go to the victims of slavery. Instead it was paid to the powerful and rich slave owners who made their astronomical wealth off the back of this evil trade. People like John Gladstone, the father of prime minister William Gladstone, received £,, the equivalent of £million, in compensation for the , men, women and children regarded as his “property”. Samantha Cameron is a descendant of William Jollfe, a slave owner who received £,, around £million in today’s money, in compensation for his  slaves. Her husband, former prime minister David Cameron, also had slave owners in his family who were awarded thousands of pounds for their “loss”. In total some , slave-owning ­families received payment. Much of the £million “compensation” was borrowed – and the debt so huge it wasn’t paid off until . Which means that taxpayers until very recently were footing the bill – something the Treasury thought was an appropriate #FridayFact on Twitter. It’s shocking to think none of that money went to victims. The effects of slavery remain today. Almost  years later black people are battling racism and discrimination and fighting for justice and equality. You only have to look at how black people fleeing the war in Ukraine were treated to see how far we still have to go. The issue of reparations isn’t going away. If as a country we are truly sorry for Britain’s role in the slave trade, then the very least we can do is set up a commission to look at this seriously. It’s a process that is under way in Calornia. I’ve spoken to friends of Caribbean heritage, some of who say it’s not about the money, rather it’s about the ­willingness to accept that countries like Britain and America were built on the backs of slave labour and to say a proper sorry. No amount of money can make up for the hurt and the legacy of slavery but isn’t a meaningful conversation about reparations the least the victims of slavery and their descendants deserve  Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Royal FamilyPrince WilliamWilliam and KateCaribbeanRacismDavid CameronSamantha CameronDaily Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news world-news russia-bombs-red-cross-building-"Russian missiles being fired from Chernobyl into UkraineByChris Hughes in Ivano Frankivsk, Ukraine:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Russian forces blitzed a Red Cross building in Ukraine today - within  hours of peace-talks aimed at ending their bloody invasion.The complex - clearly marked with the famous red cross and white background sign - was struck with artillery and targeted by warplanes. It was the latest possible barbaric war crime committed by Moscow’s troops amid growing doubt about Kremlin peace negotiations.The red cross building is in besieged port city Mariupol where officials warn a desperate humanitarian disaster is fast unfolding with thousands killed by Russia.Ukrainian ombudswoman Lyudmyla Denisova said: “In Mariupol, the occupiers aimed at the building of the International Committee of the Red Cross .She said that on Wednesday the building came under fire even though its roof is marked with an internationally recognised Red Cross symbol.The symbol marks out that the structure holds wounded or ill people, or civilian or humanitarian cargo and is clearly visible from the air.  She added: “This is another war crime by the Russian Army in accordance with the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court and a gross violation of the  Geneva Conventions.“I call on the world community to condemn the barbaric actions of the occupying country in shelling the ICRC building and to take measures to end the bloody war on the territory of Ukraine as soon as possible.” There is overwhelming evidence now of apartment buildings, residences, hospitals, cultural venues, and shopping malls destroyed by Russian bombs. As many as  people have been slaughtered by Russian airstrikes and shooting in Irpin, near Kyiv before the town was snatched back by Ukraine this week. Mayor Oleksandr Markushyn confirmed that he believed many bodies of victims still lie beneath the rubbled buildings. It was revealed by Ukraine today that  children have now died from Russian attacks and  have been wounded.  Ukrainian forces have repeatedly counter-attacked Russian troops around the capital and in other cities throughout the country, driving them back. Many observers and analysts believe Russian claims of a withdrawal from Kyiv and Chernihiv coincide with Moscow suffering huge losses. A former western intelligence officer told the Daily Mirror: “This is not about the Kremlin seriously negotiating a peace deal with Ukraine. “It is about Russia regrouping, consolidating, re-arming and forming new battle plans to try and bring Ukraine to its knees, whilst leaving it ruined. “The Kremlin knows its forces have been hammered with losses of more than , and there is huge cynicism about their intentions to negotiate.” London-based security sources added that their counterparts in the United States were also “highly doubtful” about Russian sincerity regarding peace. Today a former Ukrainian national security adviser to President Volodymyr Zelensky cast doubt on Russian pledges to stop attacking Kyiv and Chernihiv.Moscow negotiators had suggested they will partially withdraw from the two cities as a gesture to gain trust from Ukrainian peace negotiators in Istanbul, Turkey. But Kyiv suffered a massive cyber attack within hours and by morning Ukraine announced there was “no evidence” of a Russian withdrawal.The capital’s Ministry of Defence reported a “massive” and “ongoing” cyber attack on its official website - with Russian hackers being prime suspects.Oleksander Danylyuk said the sound of shelling this morning had confirmed his fears.  He added: ”This is just regrouping,” and he added that Russia is “not going to ease their grab” on Kyiv and Chernihiv – “this is just words.” He continued: “As always there are military and diplomatic KGB games all combined, this is just one game.” Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky echoed fears that Moscow is not serious about de-escalating as peace talks continue. He said: “Yes, we can call those signals that we hear at the negotiations positive. But those signals don’t silence the explosions of Russian shells. “Of course we see the risks. Of course we don’t see any basis for trusting the words voiced by those or other representatives of the state that is continuing to fight for our destruction.” Mayor of Ukrainian city Ivano Frankivsk Ruslan Martsynkiv, told the Daily Mirror: “I do not believe the Russians intend to stop this attack - not at all. “Eventhere was a peace deal negotiated, they will start the war again within a year, maybe even sooner. Nobody believes them and why should they, given what they are doing ” Negotiations resumed this morning, five weeks into what has devolved into a bloody war of attrition, with thousands dead, almost four million Ukrainians fleeing the country and nearly ten million displaced.UK Deputy Prime Minister Dominic Raab has said UK sanctions against Russia will remain in place until the invasion of Ukraine is “withdrawn.”He added: “The sanctions are there to tighten the grip on Putin’s war machine.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Red CrossInternational Committee of the Red Cross Ministry of DefenceInternational Criminal CourtRoman AbramovichVladimir PutinHospitalsWar crimesCrimeRussia Ukraine warDaily Mirror,callToAction:ltpgtGet weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emaillt pgt,buttonText:,contentId:,newsletterImage:https:i-prod.mirror article.ece ALTERNATES sd _AlisonHeaderFinal.png,endpointUrl:https:response.pure interface list.php,profile:Reach_Mirror,isPureNewsLetter:true,pureMailingListId:Mirror - Alisons Newsletter,isDoubleOptIn:,newsletterSiteName:Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emailInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: russian banking oligarch moans sanctions
story: Russian banking oligarch moans that sanctions mean he can’t even pay in a restaurantMikhail Fridman, who reportedly lives alone in Athlone House and has a net wealth of £. billion, was sanctioned by the UK government on March Mikhail Fridman, the co-founder of the Alfa-Group Image: REUTERSByAlice PeacockNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsA Russian oligarch who lives on the edge of Hampstead Heath is demanding UK authorities give him an allowance to buy food as he currently has to “eat at home”Mikhail Fridman, who is the founder of Russia ’s largest private bank Alfa-Bank, is claiming he is “practically under house arrest” as a result of the sanctions.Mr Fridman, who reportedly lives alone in Athlone House and has a net wealth of £. billion, was sanctioned by the UK government on March . He was formerly the director of LetterOne, a company that owns shares in health food company Holland  Barrett, before he stood down from the position earlier this month. Mr Fridman, who has lived in London for eight years, told Spanish news outlet El Pais that UK authorities should give him a “certain amount” to enable him to buy food and ride in a taxi. He acknowledged this would be a “very limited amount” in relation to the cost of living in London.  I can’t even pay in a restaurant,” he said. I have to eat at home and I am practically under house arrest. I’ve been in London for eight years, I’ve invested billions of dollars in Britain and other European countries and the answer to this is that they confiscate everything and throw me out.” Mr Fridman said the people who have been sanctioned would have toto Russia, where they would have “no choice but to be absolutely loyal”. There, they would continue to work, and would start businesses and create jobs, he said.Mr Fridman had previously expressed his views opposing Putinaposs invasion of Ukraine in an email to LetterOne Staff.He wrote about how the war would “cost lives and damage two nations”.  He wrote: I do not make political statements, I am a businessman with responsibilities to my many thousands of employees in Russia and Ukraine. I am convinced however that war can never be the answer. This crisis will cost lives and damage two nations who have been brothers for hundreds of years. While a solution seems frighteningly far off, I can only join those whose fervent desire is for the bloodshed to end.” He said he was “sure” his partners would share his view. The UK’s Foreign Secretary Liz Trus last week announced  further sanctions, including the one imposed on Alfa-Bank. Earlier this month the UK hit iniduals, businesses and banks with sanctions in response to Putin’s invasion of Ukraine. Truss said: These oligarchs, businesses and hired thugs are complicit in the murder of innocent civilians and it is right that they pay the price.  Putin should be under no illusions – we are united with our allies and will keep tightening the screw on the Russian economy to help ensure he fails in Ukraine. There will be no let-up. All those sanctioned today will have their assets in the UK frozen which means no UK citizen or company can do business with them, and iniduals subject to travel bans are also prohibited from travelling to or from the UK. Today’s sanctions will bring the total global asset value of the banks the UK has sanctioned since the invasion to £billion and the net worth of the oligarchs and family members in excess of £billion. title: sheep in shetland
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.
